meanings.definition: Shoot below the target or intended point.
meanings.sent1: The archer kept undershooting the bullseye during practice.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't undershoot the basketball hoop when I shoot.
meanings.sent3: The robot's aim was so bad, it kept undershooting and hitting the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her words always undershoot the mark, never quite hitting the point.
meanings.sent5: The rocket undershot its target, landing far from where it was supposed to.

meanings.definition: Fall short of a goal or expectation.
meanings.sent1: I always feel disappointed when I end up undershooting my sales target.
meanings.sent2: The student was worried about undershooting the teacher's expectations for the project.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes always undershoot the audience's laughter threshold.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence seemed to undershoot her actual abilities, leading to self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The team's performance undershot everyone's predictions, surprising even themselves.
